   21: %%
   22: -module(dtls_api_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: %% Callback functions
   25: -export([all/0,
   26:          groups/0,
   27:          init_per_suite/1,
   28:          end_per_suite/1,
   29:          init_per_group/2,
   30:          end_per_group/2,
   31:          init_per_testcase/2,
   32:          end_per_testcase/2]).
   33: 
   34: %% Testcases
   35: -export([
   36:          replay_window/0, replay_window/1,
   37:          dtls_listen_owner_dies/0,
   38:          dtls_listen_owner_dies/1,
   39:          dtls_listen_close/0,
   40:          dtls_listen_close/1,
   41:          dtls_listen_reopen/0,
   42:          dtls_listen_reopen/1,
   43:          dtls_listen_both_family/0,
   44:          dtls_listen_both_family/1,
   45:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_1/0,
   46:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_1/1,
   47:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_2/0,
   48:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_2/1,
   49:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_3/0,
   50:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_3/1,
   51:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_4/0,
   52:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_4/1,
   53:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_5/0,
   54:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_5/1,
   55:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_6/0,
   56:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_6/1,
   57:          client_restarts/0, client_restarts/1,
   58:          client_restarts_multiple_acceptors/1
   59:         ]).
   60: 
   61: -include("ssl_test_lib.hrl").
   62: -include_lib("ssl/src/ssl_internal.hrl").
   63: 
   64: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   65: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   66: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   67: all() ->
   68:     [
   69:      replay_window,
   70:      {group, 'dtlsv1.2'},
   71:      {group, 'dtlsv1'}
   72:     ].
   73: 
   74: groups() ->
   75:     [
   76:      {'dtlsv1.2', [],  api_tests()},
   77:      {'dtlsv1', [],  api_tests()}
   78:     ].
   79: 
   80: api_tests() ->
   81:     [
   82:      dtls_listen_owner_dies,
   83:      dtls_listen_close,
   84:      dtls_listen_reopen,
   85:      dtls_listen_both_family,
   86:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_1,
   87:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_2,
   88:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_3,
   89:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_4,
   90:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_5,
   91:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_6,
   92:      client_restarts,
   93:      client_restarts_multiple_acceptors
   94:     ].
   95: 
   96: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   97:     catch crypto:stop(),
   98:     try crypto:start() of
   99: 	ok ->
  100: 	    ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
  101: 	    ssl_test_lib:make_rsa_cert(Config0)
  102:     catch _:_ ->
  103: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  104:     end.
  105: 
  106: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  107:     ssl:stop(),
  108:     application:unload(ssl),
  109:     application:stop(crypto).
  110: 
  111: 
  112: init_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  113:     ssl_test_lib:init_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  114: 
  115: end_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  116:     ssl_test_lib:end_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  117: 
  118: init_per_testcase(Testcase, Config)
  119:   when Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_1 orelse
  120:        Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_5 orelse
  121:        Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_6 ->
  122:     case ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,2}}]) of
  123:         {ok, S} ->
  124:             test_listen_on_all_interfaces(S, Config),
  125:             ssl:close(S),
  126:             ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
  127:             ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  128:             maybe_skip_tc_on_windows(Testcase, Config);
  129:         {error, _} ->
  130:             {skip, "127.0.0.x address not available"}
  131:     end;
  132: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  133:     ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
  134:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  135:     Config.
  136: 
  137: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->     
  138:     Config.
  139: 
  140: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  141: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  142: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  143: 
  144: dtls_listen_owner_dies() ->
  145:     [{doc, "Test that you can start new DTLS 'listener' if old owner dies"}].
  146: 
  147: dtls_listen_owner_dies(Config) when is_list(Config) ->    
  148:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  149:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  150:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  151: 
  152:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  153:     {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> {ok, _} =
  154:                                             ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  155:                                         [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  156:                                         {error, _} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts])
  157:                                end),
  158:     receive
  159:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, Pid, _} ->
  160:             ok
  161:     end,
  162: 
  163:     timer:sleep(200),  %% Async closing of port owner
  164:     [] = listener_and_ports(),   %% Verify that ports are cleaned up after listener owner dies
  165:     {ok, LSocket} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  166:     [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  167:     spawn(fun() ->
  168:                   {ok, ASocket} = ssl:transport_accept(LSocket),
  169:                   {ok, Socket} = ssl:handshake(ASocket),
  170:                   receive
  171:                       {ssl, Socket, "from client"} ->
  172:                           ssl:send(Socket, "from server"),
  173:                           ssl:close(Socket)
  174:                   end
  175:           end),
  176:     {ok, Client} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts),
  177: 
  178:     ssl:send(Client, "from client"),
  179:     receive
  180:         {ssl, Client, "from server"} ->
  181:             ssl:close(Client)
  182:     end.
  183: 
  184: dtls_listen_close() ->
  185:     [{doc, "Test that you close a DTLS 'listener' socket"}].
  186: 
  187: dtls_listen_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  188:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  189:     {_, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  190: 
  191:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  192:     {ok, ListenSocket} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  193:     [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  194:     ok = ssl:close(ListenSocket),
  195:     timer:sleep(200),
  196:     [] = listener_and_ports(),
  197:     {ok, ListenSocket2} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  198:     [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  199:     ok = ssl:close(ListenSocket2, 500),
  200:     timer:sleep(200),
  201:     [] = listener_and_ports(),
  202:     ok.
  203: 
  204: dtls_listen_reopen() ->
  205:     [{doc, "Test that you close a DTLS 'listner' socket and open a new one for the same port"}].
  206: 
  207: dtls_listen_reopen(Config) when is_list(Config) -> 
  208:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  209:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  210:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  211: 
  212:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  213:     {ok, LSocket0} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  214:      spawn(fun() ->
  215:                   {ok, ASocket} = ssl:transport_accept(LSocket0),
  216:                    {ok, Socket} = ssl:handshake(ASocket),
  217:                    receive
  218:                        {ssl, Socket, "from client"} ->
  219:                            ssl:send(Socket, "from server 1"),
  220:                            ssl:close(Socket)
  221:                    end
  222:            end),
  223:     {ok, Client1} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts),
  224:     ok = ssl:close(LSocket0),
  225:     {ok, LSocket1} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  226:     spawn(fun() ->
  227:                   {ok, ASocket} = ssl:transport_accept(LSocket1),
  228:                   {ok, Socket} = ssl:handshake(ASocket),
  229:                   receive
  230:                       {ssl, Socket, "from client"} ->
  231:                           ssl:send(Socket, "from server 2"),
  232:                           ssl:close(Socket)
  233:                    end
  234:           end),
  235:     {ok, Client2} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ClientOpts]),
  236:     ssl:send(Client2, "from client"),
  237:     ssl:send(Client1, "from client"),
  238:     receive
  239:         {ssl, Client1, "from server 1"} ->
  240:             ssl:close(Client1)
  241:     end,
  242:     receive
  243:         {ssl, Client2, "from server 2"} ->
  244:             ssl:close(Client2)
  245:     end.
  246: 
  247: dtls_listen_both_family() ->
  248:     [].
  249: %%    [{require, ipv6_hosts}].
  250: dtls_listen_both_family(Config) ->
  251:     {ok, Hostname0} = inet:gethostname(),
  252: 
  253:     TestIPV6 = case ct:get_config(ipv6_hosts) of
  254:                   Hosts when is_list(Hosts) ->
  255:                       lists:member(list_to_atom(Hostname0), Hosts);
  256:                   undefined ->
  257:                       ct:log("Local tests (ipv6 probably works)", []),
  258:                       true
  259:               end,
  260:     case TestIPV6 of
  261:         true ->
  262:             {_, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  263:             Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  264:             {ok, ListenSocket} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  265:             [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  266: 
  267:             {ok, ListenSocketIpV6} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, inet6, {ipv6_v6only,true}]),
  268:             [_,_] = listener_and_ports(),
  269: 
  270:             ok = ssl:close(ListenSocket),
  271:             ok = ssl:close(ListenSocketIpV6);
  272:         false ->
  273:             {skip, "Host does not support IPv6"}
  274:     end.
  275: 
  276: dtls_listen_two_sockets_1() ->
  277:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: 127.0.0.2:Port, 127.0.0.3:Port"}].
  278: dtls_listen_two_sockets_1(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  279:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,2}}]),
  280:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  281:     {ok, S2} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  282:     ssl:close(S1),
  283:     ssl:close(S2),
  284:     ok.
  285: 
  286: dtls_listen_two_sockets_2() ->
  287:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: <all_interfaces>:Port, <all_interfaces>:Port"}].
  288: dtls_listen_two_sockets_2(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  289:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  290:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  291:     {error, already_listening} =
  292:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  293:     ssl:close(S1),
  294:     ok.
  295: 
  296: dtls_listen_two_sockets_3() ->
  297:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: <all_interfaces>:Port, <all_interfaces>:Port"}].
  298: dtls_listen_two_sockets_3(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  299:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  300:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  301:     {error, already_listening} =
  302:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  303:     ssl:close(S1),
  304:     {ok, S2} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  305:     ssl:close(S2),
  306:     ok.
  307: 
  308: dtls_listen_two_sockets_4() ->
  309:   [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: process1 - <all_interfaces>:Port, process2 - <all_interfaces>:Port"}].
  310: dtls_listen_two_sockets_4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  311:     Test = self(),
  312:     Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  313:                   {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  314:                   {ok, {_, Port0}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  315:                   Test ! {self(), Port0}
  316:                 end),
  317:     Port =
  318:         receive
  319:             {Pid, Port1} ->
  320:                 Port1
  321:         end,
  322:     {ok, S2} =
  323:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  324:     ssl:close(S2),
  325:     ok.
  326: 
  327: dtls_listen_two_sockets_5() ->
  328:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: <all_interfaces>:Port, 127.0.0.3:Port"}].
  329: dtls_listen_two_sockets_5(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  330:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  331:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  332:     {error, already_listening} =
  333:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  334:     ssl:close(S1),
  335:     {ok, S2} =
  336:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  337:     {error, already_listening} =
  338:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  339:     ssl:close(S2),
  340:     ok.
  341: 
  342: dtls_listen_two_sockets_6() ->
  343:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: 127.0.0.3:Port, 0.0.0.0:Port"}].
  344: dtls_listen_two_sockets_6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  345:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  346:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  347:     {error, already_listening} =
  348:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {0,0,0,0}}]),
  349:     ssl:close(S1),
  350:     ok.
  351: 
  352: listener_and_ports() ->
  353:     Pids = [Pid || {_, Pid, _, _} <- supervisor:which_children(dtls_listener_sup)],
  354:     PidPorts = [{erlang:port_info(P, connected), P}
  355:                 || P <- erlang:ports(), "udp_inet" == erlang:port_info(P, name)],
  356:     PidWithoutPort = [Pid || Pid <- Pids, not lists:keymember(Pid, 1, PidPorts)],
  357:     PidPorts ++ PidWithoutPort.
  358: 
  359: replay_window() ->
  360:     [{doc, "Whitebox test of replay window"}].
  361: replay_window(_Config) ->
  362:     W0 = dtls_record:init_replay_window(),
  363:     Size = 58,
  364:     true = replay_window(0, 0, Size-1, [], W0),
  365:     ok.
  366: 
  367: replay_window(N, Top, Sz, Used, W0) when N < 99000 ->
  368:     Bottom = max(0, Top - Sz),
  369:     Seq = max(0, Bottom + rand:uniform(Top-Bottom+10)-5),
  370:     IsReplay = (Seq < Bottom) orelse lists:member(Seq, Used),
  371:     case dtls_record:is_replay(Seq,W0) of
  372:         true when IsReplay ->
  373:             replay_window(N+1, Top, Sz, Used, W0);
  374:         false when (not IsReplay) ->
  375:             #{replay_window:=W1} = dtls_record:update_replay_window(Seq, #{replay_window=>W0}),
  376:             NewTop = if Seq > Top -> Seq;
  377:                         true -> Top
  378:                      end,
  379:             NewBottom = max(0, (NewTop - Sz)),
  380:             NewUsed = lists:dropwhile(fun(S) -> S < NewBottom end,
  381:                                       lists:sort([Seq|Used])),
  382:             replay_window(N+1, NewTop, Sz, NewUsed, W1);
  383:         Replay ->
  384:             io:format("Try: ~p Top: ~w Sz: ~p Used:~p State: ~w~n", [N, Top, Sz, length(Used), W0]),
  385:             io:format("Seq: ~w Replay: ~p (~p)~n ~w~n ~w~n",
  386:                       [Seq, Replay, IsReplay, Used, bits_to_list(W0)]),
  387:             {fail, Replay, Seq, W0}
  388:     end;
  389: replay_window(N, Top, Sz, Used, W0) ->
  390:     io:format("Try: ~p Top: ~w Sz: ~p Used:~p State: ~w~n", [N, Top, Sz, length(Used), W0]),
  391:     io:format("Match ~w ~n", [bits_to_list(W0) =:= Used]),
  392:     bits_to_list(W0) =:= Used.
  393: 
  394: bits_to_list(#{mask := Bits, bottom:= Bottom}) ->
  395:     bits_to_list(Bits, Bottom, []).
  396: 
  397: bits_to_list(0, _, Is) ->
  398:     lists:reverse(Is);
  399: bits_to_list(Bits, I, Acc) ->
  400:     case Bits band 1 of
  401:         1 -> bits_to_list(Bits bsr 1, I+1, [I|Acc]);
  402:         0 -> bits_to_list(Bits bsr 1, I+1, Acc)
  403:     end.
  404: 
  405: client_restarts() ->
  406:     [{doc, "Test re-connection "}].
  407: 
  408: client_restarts(Config) ->
  409:     ClientOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  410:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  411:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  412: 
  413:     ClientOpts = [{verify, verify_none},{reuse_sessions, save} | ClientOpts0],
  414:     Server =
  415: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  416: 				   {from, self()},
  417:                                    {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  418: 				   {options, [{verify, verify_none}|ServerOpts]}]),
  419:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  420:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode},
  421:                                          {port, Port}, {host, Hostname},
  422:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  423:                                          {from, self()},
  424:                                          {options, ClientOpts}]),
  425: 
  426:     ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg1 = "from client 0"),
  427:     ssl_test_lib:send(Server, Msg2 = "from server to client 0"),
  428: 
  429:     Server ! {active_receive, Msg1},
  430:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg2},
  431: 
  432:     Msgs = lists:sort([{Server, Msg1}, {Client0, Msg2}]),
  433:     Msgs = lists:sort(flush()),
  434: 
  435:     ReConnect =  %% Whitebox re-connect test
  436:         fun({sslsocket, {gen_udp,_,dtls_gen_connection}, [Pid]} = Socket, ssl) ->
  437:                 ?CT_LOG("Client Socket: ~p ~n", [Socket]),
  438:                 {ok, IntSocket} = gen_statem:call(Pid, {downgrade, self()}),
  439:                 {{Address,CPort},UDPSocket}=IntSocket,
  440:                 ?CT_LOG("Info: ~p~n", [inet:info(UDPSocket)]),
  441: 
  442:                 {ok, #config{transport_info = CbInfo, connection_cb = ConnectionCb,
  443:                              ssl = SslOpts0}} =
  444:                     ssl:handle_options(ClientOpts, client, Address),
  445:                 SslOpts = {SslOpts0, #socket_options{}, undefined},
  446: 
  447:                 ct:sleep(250),
  448:                 ?CT_LOG("Client second connect: ~p ~p~n", [Socket, CbInfo]),
  449:                 {ok, NewSocket} = ssl_gen_statem:connect(ConnectionCb, Address, CPort, IntSocket,
  450:                                                          SslOpts, self(), CbInfo, infinity),
  451:                 {replace, NewSocket}
  452:         end,
  453: 
  454:     Client0 ! {apply, self(), ReConnect},
  455:     receive
  456:         {apply_res, {replace, Res}} ->
  457:             ?CT_LOG("Apply res: ~p~n", [Res]),
  458:             ok;
  459:         ErrMsg ->
  460:             ?CT_LOG("Unhandled: ~p~n", [ErrMsg]),
  461:             ct:fail({wrong_msg, ErrMsg})
  462:     end,
  463: 
  464:     ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg1 = "from client 0"),
  465:     ssl_test_lib:send(Server, Msg2 = "from server to client 0"),
  466: 
  467:     Server ! {active_receive, Msg1},
  468:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg2},
  469: 
  470:     Msgs = lists:sort(flush()),
  471: 
  472:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  473:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
  474:     ok.
  475: 
  476: 
  477: flush() ->
  478:     receive Msg -> [Msg|flush()]
  479:     after 500 -> []
  480:     end.
  481: 
  482: client_restarts_multiple_acceptors(Config) ->
  483:     %% Can also be tested with openssl by connecting a client and hit
  484:     %% Ctrl-C to kill openssl process, so that the connection is not
  485:     %% closed.
  486:     %% Then do a new openssl connect with the same client port.
  487: 
  488:     ClientOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  489:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  490:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  491: 
  492:     ClientOpts = [{verify, verify_none},{reuse_sessions, save} | ClientOpts0],
  493:     Server =
  494: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  495: 				   {from, self()},
  496:                                    {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  497:                                    {accepters, 2},
  498: 				   {options, [{verify, verify_none}|ServerOpts]}]),
  499:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  500:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode},
  501:                                          {port, Port}, {host, Hostname},
  502:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  503:                                          {from, self()},
  504:                                          {options, ClientOpts}]),
  505: 
  506:     Server2 = receive {accepter, 2, Server2Pid} -> Server2Pid
  507:               after 5000 -> ct:fail(msg_timeout)
  508:               end,
  509: 
  510:     ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg1 = "from client 0"),
  511:     ssl_test_lib:send(Server, Msg2 = "from server to client 0"),
  512: 
  513:     Server ! {active_receive, Msg1},
  514:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg2},
  515: 
  516:     Msgs = lists:sort([{Server, Msg1}, {Client0, Msg2}]),
  517:     Msgs = lists:sort(flush()),
  518: 
  519:     ReConnect =  %% Whitebox re-connect test
  520:         fun({sslsocket, {gen_udp,_,dtls_gen_connection}, [Pid]} = Socket, ssl) ->
  521:                 ?CT_LOG("Client Socket: ~p ~n", [Socket]),
  522:                 {ok, IntSocket} = gen_statem:call(Pid, {downgrade, self()}),
  523:                 {{Address,CPort},UDPSocket}=IntSocket,
  524:                 ?CT_LOG("Info: ~p~n", [inet:info(UDPSocket)]),
  525: 
  526:                 {ok, #config{transport_info = CbInfo, connection_cb = ConnectionCb,
  527:                              ssl = SslOpts0}} =
  528:                     ssl:handle_options(ClientOpts, client, Address),
  529:                 SslOpts = {SslOpts0, #socket_options{}, undefined},
  530: 
  531:                 ct:sleep(250),
  532:                 ?CT_LOG("Client second connect: ~p ~p~n", [Socket, CbInfo]),
  533:                 {ok, NewSocket} = ssl_gen_statem:connect(ConnectionCb, Address, CPort, IntSocket,
  534:                                                          SslOpts, self(), CbInfo, infinity),
  535:                 {replace, NewSocket}
  536:         end,
  537: 
  538:     Client0 ! {apply, self(), ReConnect},
  539:     receive
  540:         {apply_res, {replace, Res}} ->
  541:             ?CT_LOG("Apply res: ~p~n", [Res]),
  542:             ok;
  543:         ErrMsg ->
  544:             ?CT_LOG("Unhandled: ~p~n", [ErrMsg]),
  545:             ct:fail({wrong_msg, ErrMsg})
  546:     end,
  547: 
  548:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg3 = "from client 2"),
  549:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send(Server2, Msg4 = "from server 2 to client 2"),
  550:     {error, closed} = ssl_test_lib:send(Server,  "Should be closed"),
  551: 
  552:     Msgs2 = lists:sort([{Server2, Msg3}, {Client0, Msg4}]),
  553: 
  554:     Server2 ! {active_receive, Msg3},
  555:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg4},
  556: 
  557:     Msgs2 = lists:sort(flush()),
  558: 
  559:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  560:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server2),
  561:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
  562:     ok.
  563: 
  564: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  565: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
  566: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  567: 
  568: %% Helper function for init_per_testcase.
  569: test_listen_on_all_interfaces(S0, Config) ->
  570:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S0),
  571:     case ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {0,0,0,0}}]) of
  572:         {ok, S1} ->
  573:             ssl:close(S0),
  574:             ssl:close(S1),
  575:             {skip, "Testcase is not supported on this OS."};
  576:         {error, _} ->
  577:             Config
  578:     end.
  579: 
  580: maybe_skip_tc_on_windows(Testcase, Config)
  581:   when Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_5 orelse
  582:        Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_6 ->
  583:     case os:type() of
  584:         {win32, _} ->
  585:             {skip, "Testcase not supported in Windows"};
  586:         _ ->
  587:             Config
  588:     end;
  589: maybe_skip_tc_on_windows(_, Config) ->
  590:     Config.
